heading: # Intersection observer
headingText: The `v-intersect` directive utilizes the [Intersection Observer API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API). It provides an easy-to-use interface for detecting when elements are visible within the user's viewport. This is also used for the [v-lazy](/components/lazy) component.

usage.desc: Scroll the window and watch the colored dot. Notice as the [v-card](/components/cards) comes into view that it changes from error to success

options.heading: ### With options
options.desc: The `v-intersect` directive accepts options. Available options can be found in the [Intersection Observer API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API). Below is an example using the `threshold` option.

options.modifiers.once: Will only invoke the provided user callback on mount and once intersected. If using the **quiet** modifier will only invoke once.
options.modifiers.quiet: Will not automatically invoke the provided callback on bind.
options.value: The function to invoke when the targeted element is intersected.

polyfillText1: While the [Intersection Observer API](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Intersection_Observer_API) is not available in IE11 by default, it can be implemented using a [polyfill](https://github.com/w3c/IntersectionObserver).
